# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (sap hr) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.workschedule_dim)
- **New Data:** where a PA in the source does not exist as an Work_Schedule_Rule in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on PA in source and Work_Schedule_Rule in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an Work_Schedule_Rule in the target exists but the same PA doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View workschedule_dim_new is created

%%sql
-- Build workschedule_dim table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW workschedule_dim_new

    AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT 
    CASE
        WHEN T1.Work_Schedule_Rule IS NULL
        THEN first(T7.WorkScheduleID)
        ELSE NULL
    END as WorkScheduleID, -- surrogate key
    Work_Schedule_Rule AS WorkScheduleRule, -- source system id
    WkDys AS WorkWeekDays,
    Wk_hrs AS WorkWeekHours,
    Hrs_Day AS WorkDayHours, 
    First(T2.SourceSystemID) as SourceSystemID,
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS StartDate,
    NULL AS EndDate,
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS IngestionDate,
    NULL AS ValidTo,
    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Work_Schedule_Rule,'.'), IFNULL(T1.WkDys,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Wk_hrs,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Hrs_Day,'.'))) as RowID,
    'Y' as IsActive,
    CASE
        WHEN T1.Work_Schedule_Rule = FIRST(T7.WorkScheduleRule) AND
            T1.WkDys = FIRST(T7.WorkWeekDays) AND
            T1.Wk_hrs = FIRST(T7.WorkWeekHours) AND
            T1.Hrs_Day = FIRST(T7.WorkDayHours) AND
            md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Work_Schedule_Rule,'.'), IFNULL(T1.WkDys,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Wk_hrs,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Hrs_Day,'.'))) <> first(T7.RowID)    -- same employee, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN first(T7.WorkScheduleRule) IS NULL -- new work schedule
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END as NewData,
    CASE
        WHEN T1.Work_Schedule_Rule IS NULL
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END AS  DeletedData


FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_absences T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "SAP HR" = T2.Description and T2.IsActive = 'Y'
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.workschedule_dim T7 ON T1.Work_Schedule_Rule = T7.WorkScheduleRule AND
                                                    T1.WkDys = T7.WorkWeekDays AND
                                                    T1.Wk_hrs = T7.WorkWeekHours AND
                                                    T1.Hrs_Day = T7.WorkDayHours
WHERE  (T7.IsActive = 'Y' or T7.IsActive IS NULL)
    
        AND (
        
        -- flags new data        
        ( CASE
                WHEN T1.Work_Schedule_Rule = T7.WorkScheduleRule AND
                    T1.WkDys = T7.WorkWeekDays AND
                    T1.Wk_hrs = T7.WorkWeekHours AND
                    T1.Hrs_Day = T7.WorkDayHours AND
                    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Work_Schedule_Rule,'.'), IFNULL(T1.WkDys,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Wk_hrs,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Hrs_Day,'.'))) <> T7.RowID   -- same employee, changed data
                THEN 'Y'
                WHEN T7.WorkScheduleRule IS NULL -- new work schedule
                THEN 'Y'
                ELSE 'N'
            END  = 'Y' ) OR
        
        -- flags deleted data
        ( CASE
            WHEN T1.Work_Schedule_Rule IS NULL
            THEN 'Y'
            ELSE 'N'
        END = 'Y' )
)


GROUP BY T1.Work_Schedule_Rule, T1.WkDys, T1.Wk_hrs, T1.Hrs_Day

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **workschedule_dim_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View workschedule_dim_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Creating new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW workschedule_dim_changed_rows

    AS

SELECT 
    WorkScheduleID,
    WorkScheduleRule,
    WorkWeekDays,
    WorkWeekHours,
    WorkDayHours,
    SourceSystemID,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM workschedule_dim_new

    UNION ALL

SELECT
    WorkScheduleID,
    WorkScheduleRule,
    WorkWeekDays,
    WorkWeekHours,
    WorkDayHours,
    SourceSystemID,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.workschedule_dim
WHERE WorkScheduleRule IN (SELECT WorkScheduleRule FROM workschedule_dim_new WHERE WorkScheduleID IS NULL);

# View workschedule_dim_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. PA from SAPHR), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised.workschedule_dim is updated

%%sql
-- merge into fact table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.workschedule_dim AS Target
USING workschedule_dim_changed_rows AS Source

ON Source.WorkScheduleID = Target.WorkScheduleID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.EndDate = date_sub(current_timestamp,1),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT * ;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.workschedule_dim is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new WorkScheduleID

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.workschedule_dim

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY WorkScheduleID NULLS LAST) AS WorkScheduleID,
    WorkScheduleRule,
    WorkWeekDays,
    WorkWeekHours,
    WorkDayHours,
    SourceSystemID,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.workschedule_dim;
